revision.text:
{{Wired embedded system |brand=Toshiba |model=PCX2500 |revision=(DAZ8821F) |asin= |manuf_country=Taiwan |is_manuf=Yes |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |est_release_date=11/2002 |type=cable modem |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Texas Instruments |cpu1_model=TNETC4400;TNETC4400PYP, DB2BA4T5J; |cpu1_cspeed=100 |fla1=2 MiB |fla1_brand=STMicro |fla1_model=M28W160CT |ram1=8 MiB |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=HY57V641620HG |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag=yes,, 14-pin header,, JP2 |serial=yes,, 6-pin header,, (9600 8N1),, JP3 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Realtek |eth_chip2_model=RTL8201L |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips= |flags=DOCSIS 1.0 |stock_boot= |stock_os=VxWorks |tp_firmware= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|Cable Modem}} "KMA320010903", "TANSUI-A", "PCX V:X3", and a date code :of '''0245''' is silkscreened on one PCX2500's board. It's presumed to be running VxWorks. :CPU: PUMA, Board: Tansui, vxTarget *[http://www.haxorware.com/forums/showthread.php?tid=525 ''Toshiba PCX2500'' thread on the '''Haxorware''' forums] :The board image shown ([http://haxorware.com/forums/thread-88.html from here]) has a different :layout than the one populating this entry. ===JTAG=== *'''TCK''' – the TCK or 'test clock' synchronizes the internal state machine operations. *'''TMS''' – the TMS or 'test mode state' is sampled at the rising edge of TCK to determine the next state. *'''TDI''' – the TDI or 'test data in' represents the data shifted into the device's test or programming logic. :It is sampled at the rising edge of TCK when the internal state machine is in the correct state. *'''TDO''' – the TDO or 'test data out' represents the data shifted out of the device's test or programming :logic and is valid on the falling edge of TCK when the internal state machine is in the correct state. *'''TRST''' – the TRST or 'test reset' is an optional pin which, when available, can reset the TAP controller's :state machine. *'''GND''' - the GND or 'ground'. ===Serial=== ====Pinout==== 
1 [3.3] (GND) 2
3 (TxD) (GND) 4
5 (RxD) (GND) 6  JP3
